snippet: Assurant, the QBE Insurance Group and American Modern Home Insurance were ordered to submit new rate proposals after hearings showed they charged too much for force-placed insurance coverage.
abstract: New York State is demanding that insurers that write policies to cover financially troubled homeowners submit new rate proposals after hearings showed companies charged too much for the coverage; Assurant, QBE Insurance Group and American Modern Home Insurance, which make up more than 90 percent of the so-called force-placed insurance market in New York, were sent the order.
lead_paragraph: Assurant, the QBE Insurance Group and American Modern Home Insurance were ordered to submit new rate proposals after hearings showed they charged too much for force-placed insurance coverage.

headline.seo: New York Demands New Rates for Forced Home Insurance
headline.main: New York Seeks New Rates for Force-Placed Insurance
headline.print_headline: State Seeks New Rates For Forced Insurance
